stimulusHtml: Assume that both code segments initialize  choice  to the same integer value. Which of the following best describes the conditions on the initial value of the variable  choice  that will cause the two code segments to produce different output?

features.html:
Consider the following two code segments where the  int  variable  choice  has been properly declared and initialized.

 

Code Segment 1

if (choice > 10) 
{ 
   System.out.println("blue"); 
} 
else if (choice < 5) 
{ 
   System.out.println("red"); 
} 
else 
{ 
   System.out.println("yellow"); 
}

 

Code Segment 2

if (choice > 10) 
{ 
   System.out.println("blue"); 
} 
if (choice < 5) 
{ 
   System.out.println("red"); 
} 
else 
{ 
   System.out.println("yellow"); 
}

choicesHtml: There is no value for  choice  that will cause the two code segments to produce different output.
